intro: Borrachinea, commonly known as the Brazilian pepper tree, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae and is characterized by its small, fragrant white flowers and red berries. The plant is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, thriving in well-drained soils. Borrachinea has a sprawling shrub or tree form, with smooth, dark green leaves. It is sometimes cultivated for its ornamental value but can become invasive in certain environments.
